AppTitle: examly: Statistical Metrics and Reporting Tool
SetItemTypesNote: (All items are assumed 'Multiple Choice'. Click to change item types.)
MCKeyPasteHelp1: Paste answers IN ORDER for the following __N__ multiple-choice items.
TFKeyPasteHelp1: Paste answers IN ORDER for the following __N__ true/false items.
LCNote: Note: For open-ended items, values in the dataset must be the score (points) the student received for that item.
Overall_ptxt_low: Mean item difficulty is low; most items are hard.
Overall_ptxt_mid: Mean item difficulty is moderate; test difficulty is balanced.
Overall_ptxt_high: Mean item difficulty is high; most items are easy.
Overall_rtxt_low: Mean item discrimination is low; items may not distinguish well between high- and low-performing students.
Overall_rtxt_mid: Mean item discrimination is moderate; items partly distinguish between high- and low-performing students.
Overall_rtxt_high: Mean item discrimination is high; items distinguish well between high- and low-performing students.
DistractorNeedsMCAndKey: For this analysis, the item must be multiple-choice and have an answer key.
DistractorMsg_OK: The correct option (key) is selected by a higher proportion of the 'upper group' than the 'lower group'. The item is functioning as expected.
DistractorMsg_NotOK: The correct option is not selected more frequently by the 'upper group' (compared to the 'lower group'). The answer key or item stem should be reviewed.
DistractorMsg_OkDistractors: Functional distractors are selected by a higher proportion of the 'lower group' than the 'upper group' (as expected).
DistractorMsg_BadDistractorsPrefix: Non-functional distractors (i.e., selected more by the 'upper group' than the 'lower group'):
SummaryNotReady: Summary could not be generated. Please check data and answer keys.
ReportsIntro: Click below to download reports as DOCX.
ReportsNote: (Depending on dataset size, this may take a while.)
NoMCForDistractor: No multiple-choice item available for analysis.
comment_overall.difficulty.low: Mean item difficulty is low (items are hard). This implies that the mean test score may be low.
comment_overall.difficulty.high: Mean item difficulty is high (items are easy). In this case, the test may struggle to differentiate between high- and low-performing students.
comment_overall.difficulty.mid: Mean item difficulty is moderate, indicating a balanced level of exam difficulty.
comment_overall.discrimination.low: Mean item discrimination is low; items may be weak at distinguishing between high- and low-performing students.
comment_overall.discrimination.high: Mean item discrimination is high; items adequately distinguish between high- and low-performing students.
comment_overall.discrimination.mid: Mean item discrimination is moderate; items partly distinguish between high- and low-performing students.
ItemComment_Line1: As the item difficulty index approaches 1.00, the item is considered easier; conversely, as it approaches 0.00, it is deemed harder.
ItemComment_Line2: The item discrimination coefficient reflects the correlation between the item and the total score (typically reported as the 'corrected item-total correlation').
ItemComment_Line3: The Item Reliability Index is the product of the item's standard deviation and its corrected item-total correlation. Higher values indicate a greater contribution to the scale's internal consistency.
ReportError: Report could not be generated. Error Message:
NeedItemTypesKeys: Please specify item types and provide answer keys.
FileReadError: File could not be read. Please check CSV format and delimiter/encoding settings.
StudentsPassed50: Number of students scoring 50 or higher
Interp.Note: Colors in the table are simplified to 3 groups (Low/Medium/High) for easier interpretation.
